## formatRelativeTime

Returns a human-friendly format of a relative time string.

### Parameters

*   `dateString` **[string][33]** A date string in a format that can be parsed by the JavaScript Date constructor.

Returns **[string][33]** A relative time string in the format "just now", "Xm ago", "Xh ago", or "Xday ago", or a full date string with month, day, and year if the time difference is larger than one week.

## TEMPLATE\_LINKS

A object containing various template links. Each key is a label, and each value is the corresponding template URL.

## createEntryCard

Create an entry card for an entry.

### Parameters

*   `entry` **[Object][34]** The entry to create a card for.
*   `isRecentlyEdited` **[boolean][35]** Whether the card should display the recently edited version. (optional, default `false`)

Returns **[string][33]** The HTML for the entry card.

## fetchAndDisplayRecentlyEdited

Fetches and displays the recently edited documents.

Logs a message to the console while fetching, handles HTTP errors,
sorts the documents by updated\_at in descending order, and displays them.

*   Throws **[Error][36]** If an HTTP error occurs.

## displayDocuments

Displays a list of documents in the given container.
If `showAll` is true, displays all documents; otherwise, displays only a limited number of documents.

### Parameters

*   `showAll` **[boolean][35]** Whether to display all documents or not. (optional, default `false`)

## displayRecentlyEdited

Displays a list of recently edited documents.

### Parameters

*   `showAll` **[boolean][35]** whether to display all documents or only a subset (optional, default `false`)

## refreshRecentlyEdited

Sends a custom event to the window after refreshRecentlyEdited() operations have been completed.
Firstly, it calls fetchAndDisplayRecentlyEdited() to handle the recent edits, and then fires a 'document-saved'
event to notify any event listeners.

## fetchDocuments

Fetches documents list and updates the document list container.

Logs messages to the console and handles errors.
If an error occurs, displays an alert with the error message.

## openDocument

Opens a document by its ID.

Sends a GET request to the API to retrieve the document, and then navigates to the document's page.
If the document is not found, displays an error message.

### Parameters

*   `id` **[string][33]** The ID of the document to open.

## deleteDocument

Deletes a document and refreshes the document list.
Prompts the user to confirm before deleting.

### Parameters

*   `id` **[string][33]** The ID of the document to delete

## addEventListener

Initializes UI elements to display recently edited items when the 'see more' button is clicked.

## addEventListener

Event listener for the DOMContentLoaded event. This function handles loading or creating a new document
based on the URL parameters. It also loads the meeting content and populates the UI.

## createNewBugReviewFromTemplate

Navigates to a new page based on the provided template.

If called without an argument, defaults to the bug review page.

## openModal

Opens the GitHub modal.
Fetches and fills credentials if a cached username is found in local storage.

## fetchAndFillCredentials

Fetches and fills GitHub credentials for the given username.

### Parameters

*   `username` **[string][33]** The GitHub username to fetch credentials for.

Returns **void**&#x20;

## saveGithubCredentials

Saves GitHub credentials to the backend.

Returns **void**&#x20;

## closeModal

Closes the specified modal.

## getGithubCredentials

Retrieves GitHub credentials, either by fetching a cached username or by executing
a login flow.

## createNewMeeting

Creates a new meeting document and saves it to the server.

Posting a new meeting document with the provided metadata andMarkdown content.
If the creation is successful, it updates the UI with the new document's data.
Otherwise, it throws an error.

## commitDocument

Commits the current document to the backend and updates the UI accordingly.

Retrieves the current document ID from local storage, constructs a meeting data object,
and sends it to the backend to save and commit the file. Updates the UI with the
save status and enables the save button once the operation is complete.

## saveDocument

Saves the currently edited document.

Gets the current title and content from the UI, sends the updated data to the server,
and updates the UI to reflect the save status.

## loadDocument

Loads a document by its ID.

### Parameters

*   `documentId` **[string][33]** The ID of the document to load.

<!---->

*   Throws **[Error][36]** If the document is not found.

## updateDate

Update the current date element in the page.

Set the text content of the element with id 'currentDate' to the current date in
the format year, month, and day, in English.

## scheduleAutoSave

Schedules the auto-save timer to save the document after a specified delay.
Clears any existing timer before setting a new one.
